clinical_study.brief_title: Feasibility of an Immediate Preoperative Chemotherapy Before Resection fo Colorectal Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Feasibility of an Immediate Preoperative Chemotherapy Before Resection of Colorectal Cancer and Research of Gene Expressions Changes Induced in the Tumor, Predictive of Chemotherapy Efficiency

lead_sponsor.agency: Gustave Roussy, Cancer Campus, Grand Paris

clinical_study.source: Gustave Roussy, Cancer Campus, Grand Paris

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to analyze the clinical tolerance of immediate preoperative chemotherapy in terms of toxicity and perioperative morbidity and mortality

primary_outcome.measure: Clinical tolerance of immediate preoperative chemotherapy
primary_outcome.time_frame: Assess up to 30 days after surgery
primary_outcome.description: Clinical tolerance of immediate preoperative chemotherapy assessment is based on the post-operative complication rate in terms of morbidity and mortality. All the post-operative complications arising within 30 days after surgery will be registered and classified using the Clavien Dindo classification

clinical_study.condition: Patients With Colorectal Cancer With Unresectable Synchronous Metastasis in Whom Resection of the Primitive Tumour is Indicated

arm_group.description: Systemic chemotherapy (modified FOLFOX 4) 48 hours before surgery resection of the colorectal tumor during surgery Resumption of FOLFOX within the month after surgery (post operative administration of 4 course of treatment and assessment of the response)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- colorectal metastatic adenocarcinoma (stage IV) with unresectables, measurables and visibles secondary lesions
- primitive tumor must be operate
- patient age between 18 and 70
- OMS status performance < 2
- life expectancy > 12 weeks
- hematologic function : PNN >/= 1.5x10^9/L, platelets >/= 100x10^9/L
- hepatic function : bilirubin </= 1.5xLSN, AST and ALT </= 3xLSN, alcalin phosphatasis </= 3xLSN
- plasmatimic creatin </= 1.25xLSN
- No previous chemotherapy or pelvic radiotherapy
- men and women in age of procreate agreeing to use a contraception until 4 months after the end of treatment for women and until 6 months for men
Exclusion Criteria:
- nonmetastatic forms
- Colorectal tumor which requires preoperative radiotherapy
- nonmeasurable metastasis based on RECIST criteria
- previous chemotherapy for colorectal cancer
- previous irradiation of the primitive tumour
- specific indication against the treatment studied
- Patient considered as inoperable for physiological or carcinologic reasons
- Pregnant or breast feeding women
